Others: The Phillies ended the NLCS without a hit in their final 17 plate appearances.
The 2023 NLCS was the Phillies' second consecutive playoff loss, with the team going 9-for-98, batting.092 over the final 30 innings in 2022.
Craig Kimbrel allowed the walk-off run in the ninth inning of NLCS Game 3 and blew a two-run lead in the eighth inning of Game 4, both Phillies losses.
Manager Rob Thomson went right back to Kimbrel in Game 4 a day after the 35-year-old walked two and said he didn't have it.
Taijuan Walker was on the Phillies' playoff roster in each round and did not pitch.
Lorenzen was on the roster for the NLDS and NLCS, pitching one inning against the Braves with the Phillies up eight runs and picking up five outs in Game 6 against Arizona with his team down three.
Walker tweeted about disrespect in the early hours after Game 7 of the NLCS.
The Phillies thrust 23-year-old Johan Rojas and 22-year-old Orion Kerkering into important roles almost immediately.
Rojas hit.302 in 164 regular-season plate appearances, which was not viewed as sustainable.
Kerkering was the reliever Thomson turned to up 1-0 in the seventh inning of Game 3 with the Phillies nine outs away from taking a 3-0 series lead.
Kerkering faced three batters and allowed two singles and a double to tie the game.
Thomson went right back to Kerkering the next day.
Kerkering walked Gabriel Moreno to load the bases and walked Christian Walker to force in a run.
